✖

October 13th, 2020

By: Brennan K. Brown

Another busy bee week! Time seems to be flying by for me. On the forums, I was given the Regular badge, meaning I can change thread titles, such as â€œBrennanâ€™s Beeminder Journal 2020â€ to â€œBrennanâ€™s Beeminder Journalâ€, which allows this Beejournal to continue ad infinitum, huzzah!

Regarding /morning-pages, the solution I found was to use URLminder, this will track the word count of (multiple) Google Docs or Dropbox documents. I figure Iâ€™ll add a new document each month, as I find thatâ€™s a good time-frame to segment writing. And unlike Draft, URLminder lets you change the deadline time, which was my entire problem in the first place. The caveat being that Iâ€™ll need to adjust to writing somewhere else consistently.

This weekâ€™s verbal contract will be: To get a better at understanding API. Although Iâ€™ve found multiple new systems within the unofficial integration lists that Iâ€™m excited to use, it made me realize how much more potential there isâ€“and perhaps the frustration that 3rd party solutions seem so ephemeral. Khan Academy, for instance, have deprecated their API entirely. FreeCodeCamp hasnâ€™t had theirs updated in nearly two years. Is interest in this kind of things just too niche?

On the other hand, I think thereâ€™s benefit in there only being thirty or so high-quality official integrations. I know when I first was starting out, I didnâ€™t feel overwhelmed by the paradox of choice.
